result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Chippewa County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The conviction and sentencing on 09/23/2015 has been vacated.

miscConds.notes:
Pursuant to Sentencing Hearing on 03/16/2017, Court orders defendant is to receive credit towards costs for any money previously paid.
$250 represents DNA surcharge 
$268 represents Court ordered court costs.
A total of $518 is PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. Due 4/17/2017.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$300 represents Drug Buy money.  (A total of $280.78 has been paid.  A balance of $19.22 is owed)

On 05/08/2017, Court orders a Civil Judgment for any unpaid court costs, DNA surcharge, and Drug Buy money.

Plus supervision fees.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.  
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
